title: World Bread Awards 2019: Meet the baker behind Britain's best loaf
text:
A Kentish Town-based, crowdfunded baker has picked up the top prize at the seventh Tiptree World Bread Awards (limited to Britain, despite its name), in a ceremony held at St John's Church in Hyde Park, London.

Andy Strang, who began his baking career at home in nearby Finsbury Park delivering loaves by bike to local customers in north London, won the award for his Hippy Bread, a rye and wheat sourdough bread with poppy, flax, pumpkin and sunflower seeds.

Strang opened the bricks and mortar site of Bread By Bike over two years ago, but continues the cycling theme. All the wholesale deliveries, to local restaurants, delis, cafes, pubs and hotels, are run by electric bike.

"It's pretty overwhelming to be honest," Strang told the Telegraph. "I was hoping we'd get one of the categories, but to get the overall winner was a really nice moment. To be chosen as the best is pretty amazing."

Stephen Hallam, a master baker, managing director of Dickinson & Morris, and chair of the judges, said: "Andy Strang's Hippy Bread was made with a blend of organic wheat and rye flour. It was packed with sunflower, pumpkin and poppy seeds and was fermented for 48 hours. It was the loaf that ticked all the boxes; it looked good, had a wonderful aroma and in terms of flavour it had the wow factor."
